programme.title: The Last Anniversary
programme.desc: Sophie Honeywell has just inherited a house on Scribbly Gum Island - a mysterious gift that threatens to unearth secrets held close by the three generations of women.

programme.title: The Last Anniversary
programme.desc: As Sophie settles into Scribbly Gum Island, she starts to dig further into the Baby Munro Mystery, while preparing to host the family for their first monthly dinner party since Connie's death.

programme.title: The Last Anniversary
programme.desc: Sophie discards one unsuitable suitor, just as another enters her life. Grace continues to struggle with motherhood, and her own mother, Enigma. Sophie and Veronika make a big discovery.

programme.title: The Last Anniversary
programme.desc: A DNA test brings answers about Enigma's parentage but the news pushes Rose further into her shell. Sophie explores her fling with Zeke and connects with Callum, while Grace tries to find some peace.

programme.title: The Last Anniversary
programme.desc: After more frustrating encounters with the men on the island, Sophie decides it is time to leave. Margie and Veronika uncover more clues about Alice and Jack in Connie's old family photographs.

programme.title: Love Me

programme.title: Love Me
programme.desc: Glen's holiday is turning into something unexpectedly enjoyable, Clara goes on a date with Peter, and Aaron can't believe everyone is moving on from his mother's death so soon.

programme.title: Landscape Artist of the Year
programme.desc: In the first heat, eight artists use oils, inks and raw eggs to tackle Plymouth's landmark lighthouse Smeaton's Tower, all hoping to impress judges Tai-Shan Schierenberg, Kate Bryan and Kathleen Soriano.

programme.title: Landscape Artist of the Year
programme.desc: In this second heat, eight artists take on the surreal sci-fi landscape of East Sussex's Herstmonceux Observatory in a bid to impress judges Tai-Shan Schierenberg, Kate Bryan, and Kathleen Soriano.

programme.title: Landscape Artist of the Year
programme.desc: In this third heat, eight artists set up their easels on the banks of the River Tyne to create an artwork of the engineering marvel that is the Gateshead Millennium Bridge.

programme.title: Landscape Artist of the Year
programme.desc: Eight artists are taking on the splendour of the Sussex's medieval Herstmonceux Castle, hoping to create an artwork that catches the eye of judges Tai-Shan Schierenberg, Kate Bryan and Kathleen Soriano.

programme.title: Landscape Artist of the Year
programme.desc: In this heat, eight artists head to Tyneside to capture its industrial heritage in an artwork that will impress judges Tai-Shan Schierenberg, Kate Bryan and Kathleen Soriano. The winning artist goes to the semifinal.

programme.title: Landscape Artist of the Year
programme.desc: Eight artists are challenged to create a seascape of Plymouth Sound and its beguiling Drake's Island. They must impress judges Tai-Shan Schierenberg, Kate Bryan, and Kathleen Soriano if they want to win.

programme.title: Landscape Artist of the Year
programme.desc: Six semifinalists have been chosen by judges Tai-Shan Schierenberg, Kate Bryan and Kathleen Soriano, and now they must paint the otherworldly view of dormant oil rigs that dominate the horizon.

programme.title: Landscape Artist of the Year
programme.desc: Hundreds of artists from all over the UK and Ireland have battled with brushes, rollers, paints and pencils for just three places in the final. As the sun sets, our three finalists face their toughest challenge yet.

programme.title: Landscape Artist of the Year

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Killer in Plain Sight

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Paul Hollywood Eats Mexico

programme.title: Luxury Escapes: World's Best Holidays
programme.desc: Natalie Bassingthwaighte and Hannah Hollis tour Victoria with hot springs, truffle hunts, winery feasts, Yarra cruises, and Melbourne dining.

programme.title: Nigellissima: Episode 2
programme.desc: Nigella makes an easy Italian roast chicken and a saffron orzotto, plus a surprisingly simple coffee ice cream for dessert.

programme.title: How Do They Really Do It
programme.desc: This episode goes inside Primark to reveal how a small Irish department store became Britain's biggest clothing retailer, doubling their number of stores in the last 15 years, while the rest of the high street struggles.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Next Level Chef
programme.desc: Ambitious cooks compete in a towering kitchen with three distinct levels, where access to ingredients and tools tests their creativity, skill and ability to adapt under pressure.

programme.title: The Great American Bake Off
programme.desc: Follows contestants vying to become America's top baker.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Spain
programme.desc: Rick continues his journey in the old camper van from the Basque country on the Atlantic coast, to journey eastwards towards the Mediterranean, sampling great dishes and good hospitality along the way.

programme.title: Rick Stein: From Venice to Istanbul
programme.desc: Rick Stein continues his Byzantine odyssey through Croatia, enjoying the native oysters of Ston. On Symi he cooks traditional Albanian dishes.

programme.title: James Martin's Christmas Comforts
programme.desc: James Martin gets ahead for Christmas, providing lots of clever tips and tricks to save you time and stress on the big day. Special guest is Sir Michael Parkinson.

programme.title: James Martin's Christmas Comforts
programme.desc: Christmas food made easy for the inexperienced cook. Impressive puds, Christmas Eve suppers, and magnificent mains. Special guest is Helen Skelton.

programme.title: Jamie's Fish Supper
programme.desc: Jamie cooks his favourite fish dishes, perfect for any summer supper.

programme.title: River Cottage Spring Collection
programme.desc: With fresh produce bursting into season across gardens everywhere as Spring gets underway, Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall cooks and tastes his way through the abundant crops on offer.

programme.title: Paddock To Plate
programme.desc: Matt stops at Lakes Entrance where he gets suited into waders to pull in some plate-size black bream, before heading to the home of the Four and Twenty Pie to cook a feast for the local footy team.

programme.title: Eat Well For Less NZ
programme.desc: The Tonkin's need to upskill in the kitchen and they're keen for the entire family to work together.

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the biggest tortilla factory in Europe. The Coventry site covers more than 21,000 square metres, and makes 60,000 tonnes of snacks every year.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave and Si continue their adventure on the east coast of Scotland, on the hunt for new, local ingredients to include on a menu at a beachfront cafe.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Chefs face a pasta challenge judged by pasta experts Angie Rito and Scott Tacinelli.

programme.title: Jamie's Fish Supper
programme.desc: Jamie cooks his favourite fish dishes, perfect for any summer supper.

programme.title: Jamie: Keep Cooking and Carry On

programme.title: K-9
programme.desc: Thomas Dooley is an unorthodox narcotics cop who teams with an independently minded police dog in this hilarious action-comedy.

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: The thriller that scared movie fans everywhere out of the water. Three men undertake a perilous journey to hunt down a great white killer shark.

programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
programme.desc: The Terminator is back and now he's one of the good guys, assigned to protect freedom fighter John Connor from a cyborg sent by the leader of the human resistance in the future.

programme.title: Dead Calm
programme.desc: A couple rescues a half-delirious sole survivor of a crippled schooner, but soon the stranger will plunge the unwary pair into an intense battle of cat and mouse. And life or death.

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: So you think you don't have a clue? Join the club, as high-schoolers Cher and Dionne's plan to transform a lonely misfit into a total babe backfires in the worst possible way.

programme.title: The 'Burbs
programme.desc: Suburbanite Ray Peterson's plan for a peaceful vacation is disturbed by a creepy new family on the block in this outrageous suspense-comedy directed by Joe Dante.

programme.title: Uncle Buck
programme.desc: An idle, good-natured bachelor, Uncle Buck is the last person you would think of to watch the kids. However, during a family crisis, he is suddenly left in charge of his nephew and nieces.

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: When Saturday detention started, they were the Jock, the Princess, the Brain, the Criminal, and the Basket Case, but by that afternoon they had become closer than any of them could have imagined.

programme.title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial
programme.desc: An extraterrestrial finds a friend in 10-year-old Elliot, while members of a task force work day and night to track down the whereabouts of Earth's first visitor from outer space.

programme.desc: When the sons of a cavalry colonel set out to fight a war in Europe, suspicion and jealousy threaten to tear apart their once indestructible bond when the sexy Susanna enters their lives.

programme.desc: Eddie feels blue, so Martin hires a dog psychiatrist to determine the cause of his depression.

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A spontaneous gesture gets the Crane boys a weekend double date with two attractive women.

programme.desc: Niles hosts a party to break in his new apartment. Unfortunately, his new pet bird, Baby, picks the night of the party to attach itself firmly to Niles' head.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Ray are annoyed at the over-the-top affection Robert and Amy are expressing towards each other. Robert and Amy then feel compelled to give Ray and Debra marriage advice.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra talks Ray into hiring Gianni for kitchen renovations, but his laziness causes regret. Frank's not thrilled about Gianni being the handyman either.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: After Amy invites her brother Peter to stay for dinner, he makes himself at home on the couch and never leaves. Meanwhile, Robert overhears a conversation that hits close to home.

programme.desc: When Carrie insists that Doug figure out how to invest their tax return cheque, Doug decides to buy an ice-cream truck from a stranger.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Things get out of hand as Doug frantically tries to stop a woman who claims to have spent a romantic weekend with him from calling the house.

programme.title: Japanology Plus Mini
programme.desc: There are about 900 service areas along Japan's expressways. Some feature aquariums, amusement parks, or hot spring baths. They continue to evolve, fulfilling a growing variety of functions.

programme.title: NHK Newsline

programme.title: tiny desk concerts JAPAN
programme.desc: ROTH BART BARON, the globally acclaimed folk rock band helmed by Mifune Masaya, is based in Tokyo and Berlin and renowned for their distinct sound. The group brings a one-of-a-kind performance to tdcJ.

programme.title: BOSAI
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.

programme.title: History of a Traditional Fabric
programme.desc: Yamanashi / Shibata Fumie (product designer) "Kaiki" is a thin, brightly colored silk fabric. Shibata discovers how threads are arranged to produce a layered effect that resembles a digital image.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Samurai Wisdom
programme.desc: Painted as a foolish ruler in works of fiction, fifth Tokugawa Shogun, Tsunayoshi. But is this depiction justified? Even he has wisdom to share.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to shadow or shade. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

programme.title: NHK Newsline

programme.title: The North Korean Abductions
programme.desc: North Korean agents abducted at least 17 Japanese citizens around the late 1970's. Only 5 returned. We interviewed over 100 former investigators and others to uncover why the case remains unresolved.

programme.title: Little Charo
programme.desc: Little Charo is an animation series about a Japanese dog who got lost in NY. "I want to see my owner again!" Charo starts his adventure back home. Season 2-8.

programme.title: Japanology Plus Mini
programme.desc: Japan's plastic models are popular worldwide. Shizuoka City leads the nation in plastic model shipments. We look at the city's plastic model industry, from its history to the latest developments.

programme.title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
programme.desc: Photographer Iwago Mitsuaki reunites with cats from his past! He meets Kurobe, a temple cat, for the first time in six years. He then visits a seaside town to see Ponzu for the first time in twelve.

programme.desc: Puppet action show for children. In a distant post-human future where surviving creatures have formed a community, new-breed dinosaur girl Rockie sets out on hilarious adventures with her schoolmates.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Impacts: Climates Change the World
programme.desc: Global warming is impacting ecosystems and bird habitats in the world's mountainous regions. In the Japanese Alps, various efforts are underway to protect the endangered Japanese rock ptarmigan.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We meet two crafters of bespoke fashion in Tokyo - German Melanie Uematsu whose specialties include wedding gowns for non-Japanese customers, and Australian Thom O'Brien who creates handmade hats.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Time-Lapse Japan
programme.desc: The Jomon period dates roughly from 13,000 to 300 BC. We examine various aspects of Jomon society, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: the Oyu Stone Circles.

programme.title: BOSAI
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to mud. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #3 I'm from Vietnam. / Learn how to say where you're from. The formula is the name of the place, followed by "kara kimashita".

programme.title: Tokyo's Largest Indian Community
programme.desc: In Edogawa City, where 40% of Tokyo's Indian population reside, a cultural exchange program gives Japanese residents the chance to visit Indian homes as well as facilities run by Indians.

programme.title: Hello! NHK World Japan
programme.desc: Cycle Around Japan has teamed up with Taiwan's public broadcaster, PTS, for a three-part series airing this fall. Experience Taiwan's lush scenery, and meet guardians of traditional culture.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Cinematic Journey
programme.desc: Kyle Card hikes along the 1000km trail following the Pacific Coast in northern Japanwhere he discovers local lifestyles, stunning nature, traces of the area's 2011 disaster, and resilient people.

programme.title: The Masterpieces of Tsutaju
programme.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode spotlights ukiyo-e artist Sharaku's debut work "The Actor Otani Oniji III as Edobei."

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
programme.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

programme.title: YONEZAWA
programme.desc: A 700-year-old hot spring, Shirabu Onsen, is maintained via daily trips up the slopes of the 2,000-meter mountain where it sits. See the hot spring's guardian at work, in gorgeous time-lapse footage.

programme.title: Biz Stream
programme.desc: Shoring Up Short-Handed Kitchens: This episode features new services and cooking equipment designed to help restaurants in Japan overcome a deepening labor shortage.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

programme.title: Japan Delish
programme.desc: Crisp, hot, and delicious Japanese gyoza! How did gyoza come to be so beloved in Japan? Taste the delicious truth for yourself!

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: Nishino Masatoshi didn't know what he wanted to do with his life until he learned about horse logging. Now, he's chasing his dream in the forests of Hokkaido with the help of his trusty sidekick, Kap.

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Diary
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords
programme.desc: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, two naginata (polearms) associated with legendary warriors: Benkei and Tomoe Gozen.

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Kyoto in the autumn: the old capital is even more beautiful when dressed in fall colors. Witness the contemplative and quiet beauty of Kyoto through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We meet two crafters of bespoke fashion in Tokyo - German Melanie Uematsu whose specialties include wedding gowns for non-Japanese customers, and Australian Thom O'Brien who creates handmade hats.

programme.desc: At dusk in summer, a woman is absorbed in reading a letter. This chic lady is actually an advertisement model for Mitsui Echigoya, one of the top kimono fabric stores in Edo.

programme.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode spotlights ukiyo-e artist Sharaku's debut work "The Actor Otani Oniji III as Edobei."

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Nakajima Hiromitsu makes supportive devices for world-class para-athletes such as gold medal-winning wheelchair tennis player Kamiji Yui. He talks about helping them perform at their best.

programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
programme.desc: Only 7% of rikishi make it to the top division. We learn what kind of special perks such top-division rikishi receive, and hear how even some famous Yokozuna had inauspicious beginnings.

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords
programme.desc: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, Yasutsuna, or Onikirimaru, a blade that was used to defeat a terrible demon.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: At dusk in summer, a woman is absorbed in reading a letter. This chic lady is actually an advertisement model for Mitsui Echigoya, one of the top kimono fabric stores in Edo.

programme.title: The Musical Diplomat
programme.desc: Renowned pianist Lee Kyung-mi uses her talent to foster better ties between Japan and South Korea. We trace her journey, from childhood to sharing the stage with special friends this year in Seoul.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

programme.title: YONEZAWA
programme.desc: A 700-year-old hot spring, Shirabu Onsen, is maintained via daily trips up the slopes of the 2,000-meter mountain where it sits. See the hot spring's guardian at work, in gorgeous time-lapse footage.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.desc: A growing body of research shows that continuing to exercise after a cancer diagnosis can improve post-surgical recovery, reduce recurrence rates and even increase survival rates.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We meet two crafters of bespoke fashion in Tokyo - German Melanie Uematsu whose specialties include wedding gowns for non-Japanese customers, and Australian Thom O'Brien who creates handmade hats.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Kyoto in the autumn: the old capital is even more beautiful when dressed in fall colors. Witness the contemplative and quiet beauty of Kyoto through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to mud. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: #3 I'm from Vietnam. / Learn how to say where you're from. The formula is the name of the place, followed by "kara kimashita".

programme.title: Tokyo's Largest Indian Community
programme.desc: In Edogawa City, where 40% of Tokyo's Indian population reside, a cultural exchange program gives Japanese residents the chance to visit Indian homes as well as facilities run by Indians.

programme.title: Hello! NHK World Japan
programme.desc: Cycle Around Japan has teamed up with Taiwan's public broadcaster, PTS, for a three-part series airing this fall. Experience Taiwan's lush scenery, and meet guardians of traditional culture.

programme.title: NHK Newsline

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: A week into the new year, giant torches are lit in a shrine precinct. The shadows they create enable a demon-oni-to go to a river and cleanse people of troubles. This is Oniyo: the night of the oni.

programme.title: The Masterpieces of Tsutaju

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: Nishino Masatoshi didn't know what he wanted to do with his life until he learned about horse logging. Now, he's chasing his dream in the forests of Hokkaido with the help of his trusty sidekick, Kap.

programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.

programme.desc: 92-year-old sake brewer Noguchi Naohiko has made significant contributions to the sake industry over his seven-decade career. He talks about carrying on old traditions while innovating new ones.

programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
programme.desc: We look at the penultimate 14th day of sumo tournaments, and dive into historical moments that prove this day can be as or more exciting than the final one, like an emotional brotherly title win!

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords
programme.desc: Japanese swords, admired since ancient times for their beauty, are amazing works of art. This time, a blade wielded by Miyamoto Musashi, the world's most famous swordsman: Musashi Masamune.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: Mornings begin early for fishmongers and vegetable peddlers at Nihonbashi Bridge, and here is a reason. They are not going to bow to the lord's procession. The bustling scene from everyday Edo life.

programme.title: Biz Stream
programme.desc: Shoring Up Short-Handed Kitchens: This episode features new services and cooking equipment designed to help restaurants in Japan overcome a deepening labor shortage.

programme.title: Frontrunners

programme.title: Night of the Living Dead
programme.desc: The radiation from a fallen satellite causes the recently deceased to rise from the grave and seek the living to use as food.

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles III
programme.desc: When a magic sceptre accidentally transports April back through time to 16th-century Japan, the boys take off in hot pursuit, cowabungling their way right out of the sewers.

programme.title: District B13
programme.desc: Captain Damien must team up with Leito, a local insurgent from District 13, to defuse a neutron bomb that has fallen into the hands of a local drug lord, Taha, and rescue Leito's sister Lola.

programme.title: District B13: Ultimatum
programme.desc: Explosive sequel set in a futuristic Paris. Corrupt cops conspire to launch a nuclear strike and take over a ghetto terrorised by marauding drug gangs and killers. Subtitles.

programme.title: Demonic Toys
programme.desc: Two gunrunners and a pregnant policewoman (Tracy Scoggins) are trapped in a warehouse with a bad boy's toys.

programme.title: Good Boy
programme.desc: Christian, a millionaire heir, meets Sigrid, a young student, on a dating app. They hit it off, but there's only one problem: Christian lives with Frank, a man who dresses up and constantly acts like a dog.

programme.title: Cypher
programme.desc: Paranoia drives this hi-tech cyber thriller when a computer programmer who turns to corporate espionage is caught in a spiral where even his own identity is put in doubt.

programme.title: The Wind
programme.desc: Lizzy is settling a remote stretch of land on the 19th-century American frontier, when she begins to sense a sinister presence that seems to be borne of the land itself.

programme.title: Prisoners Of The Ghostland
programme.desc: In the treacherous frontier city of Samurai Town, a notorious criminal must break an evil curse in order to rescue an abducted girl who has mysteriously disappeared.

programme.title: Howling IV: The Original Nightmare
programme.desc: A successful author moves to a small town after suffering a mental breakdown and is tormented by demons and werewolves.

programme.title: Timecrimes
programme.desc: A man accidentally gets into a time machine and travels back in time nearly an hour. Finding himself will be the first of a series of disasters of unforeseeable consequences.

programme.title: Thesis
programme.desc: A Spanish film student (Ana Torrent) finds a videotape showing the torture and murder of a missing coed.

programme.title: Severance
programme.desc: A bonding weekend goes horribly wrong for seven colleagues who find themselves facing the chop when they are sabotaged by a deadly enemy. Only the smartest will survive this brutal office outing.

programme.title: Synchronic
programme.desc: Two New Orleans paramedics' lives are ripped apart after they encounter a series of horrific deaths linked to a designer drug with bizarre, other-worldly effects.

programme.title: Crabs!
programme.desc: In the middle of prom night, a swarm of murderous crabs descends upon a small coastal town.

programme.title: New Life
programme.desc: A mysterious woman on the run, and the resourceful fixer assigned to bring her in. Their two unique stories inextricably link, as the stakes of the pursuit rise to apocalyptic proportions.

programme.title: Day of the Dead
programme.desc: The flesh-eating undead have wiped out every last vestige of the civilised world. Deep underground, a group of scientists and soldiers work to find a cure for the unstoppable plague.

programme.title: Arctic
programme.desc: Sole-survivor of a plane crash, and stranded deep within the Arctic Circle, Overgard is waiting to be rescued, when a sudden turn of events finds him no longer on his own.

programme.title: Society
programme.desc: A Beverly Hills teen (Billy Warlock) discovers his parents are part of a gruesome orgy cult for the social elite.

programme.title: The Last Stop in Yuma County
programme.desc: Stranded at an Arizona rest stop, a travelling knife salesman gets thrust into a high-stakes hostage situation by the arrival of two bank robbers who will stop at nothing to protect their ill-begotten fortune.

programme.title: The Paper Tigers
programme.desc: Three Kung Fu prodigies have grown into washed-up, middle-aged men. But when their master is murdered, they must juggle their dead-end jobs, dad duties, and old grudges to avenge his death.

programme.title: Upstream Color
programme.desc: A woman is abducted and hypnotised with an organic material harvested from a specific flower. When she falls for a man, the two realise he may also have been subjected to the same process.

programme.title: Lars and the Real Girl
programme.desc: Lars is content with his artificial girlfriend: a life-sized doll named Bianca. When he develops feelings for an attractive co-worker, Lars finds himself lost in a unique love triangle.

programme.title: Caligula: The Ultimate Cut
programme.desc: Excess, violence and corruption mark the notorious emperor's reign in first-century Rome.

programme.title: Deliver Us
programme.desc: When a nun in a remote convent claims immaculate conception, priests investigate, concerned she will give birth to twin boys: one the Messiah, the other the Anti-Christ.

programme.title: Amulet
programme.desc: An ex-soldier is offered a place to stay at a decaying house inhabited by a young woman and her dying mother. Falling for her, he suspects something sinister is going on.

programme.title: Final Cut
programme.desc: Life imitates art when the cast and crew of a low-budget zombie flick start to turn into the living dead.

programme.title: Vesper
programme.desc: Struggling to survive with her father after the collapse of Earth's ecosystem, 13-year-old Vesper must use her wits, strength and bio-hacking abilities to fight for the future.

programme.title: Vivarium
programme.desc: A young couple looking for the perfect home find themselves trapped in a mysterious labyrinth-like neighbourhood of identical houses.

programme.title: The Science of Sleep
programme.desc: A man entranced by his dreams and imagination is love-struck with a French woman and feels he can show her his world.

programme.title: Jungle
programme.desc: An enthusiastic young adventurer follows his dreams into the Amazon jungle with two friends and a guide with a mysterious past.

programme.title: Under The Silver Lake
programme.desc: Sam, a disenchanted 33-year-old finds a mysterious woman in his apartment's pool. When she vanishes, he embarks on a quest across LA, leading him down a path of mystery.

programme.title: Pusher
programme.desc: A failed drug deal lands Frank in debt to a ruthless and dangerous Copenhagen drug lord.

programme.title: The Raid
programme.desc: A SWAT team is trapped in a tenement run by a ruthless mobster and his army of killers and thugs. Stranded on the sixth floor, they must fight their way through the city's worst to survive.

programme.title: Sympathy For The Devil
programme.desc: After being forced to drive a mysterious passenger at gunpoint, a man finds himself in a high-stakes game of cat and mouse where it becomes clear that not everything is as it seems.

programme.title: Psycho Goreman
programme.desc: In this light-hearted yet violent cosmic, comedy adventure, an intergalactic warlord becomes enslaved to a pair of Earth children after they unwittingly resurrect him.

programme.title: Hellraiser IV: Bloodline
programme.desc: In the 22nd century, a scientist attempts to right the wrong his ancestor created: the puzzle box that opens the gates of Hell and unleashes Pinhead and his Cenobite legions.

programme.title: The Fall
programme.desc: A bedridden stuntman entrances a little girl with tales of exotic heroes. As his health reaches the point of peril so does the story he's telling, with dramatic consequences. An epic fantasy.

programme.title: Corrective Measures
programme.desc: When a powerless new inmate arrives at a prison for supervillains, he must choose his friends wisely, or become a pawn in the deadly game between the Warden and The Lobe.

programme.title: Wrong Place
programme.desc: A meth cook hunts down the former police chief in order to silence him before he can deliver eyewitness testimony against his family.

programme.title: Top Knot Detective
programme.desc: Takashi Takamoto begins writing jingles for a well-known Japanese company and ends up creating a bloody series of samurai action that, over time, becomes a cult series.

programme.title: Super Mario Bros.
programme.desc: Two Brooklyn plumbers, Mario and Luigi, must travel to another dimension to rescue a princess from the evil dictator King Koopa and stop him from taking over the world.

programme.title: Synchronic
programme.desc: Two New Orleans paramedics' lives are ripped apart after they encounter a series of horrific deaths linked to a designer drug with bizarre, other-worldly effects.

programme.title: Oasis
programme.desc: An irresponsible and childish ex-con befriends a girl with cerebral palsy and develops a progressively stronger bond with her.

programme.title: Color Out Of Space
programme.desc: A family's retreat to rural life quickly crumbles when a meteorite crashes into their front yard. They attempt to battle a nebulous entity that they can barely understand.

programme.title: The Chaser
programme.desc: A cop investigates the disappearance of several call girls he pimps out.

programme.title: Memento
programme.desc: A story told both forwards and backwards in time about an ex- insurance investigator, unable to remember new thoughts, who uses notes and tattoos to hunt for the man he thinks killed his wife.

programme.title: Black Robe
programme.desc: In 1634 a Jesuit missionary sets out to convert the tribes in Huron Indian country. A culture-clashing masterpiece from Australian director Bruce Beresford.

programme.title: Lords of Chaos
programme.desc: The origins of Norwegian Black Metal and a group of young men with a flair for publicity, church-burning and murder.

programme.title: Sound of Silence
programme.desc: Emma must uncover the dark secret behind a cursed radio to survive and protect her family.

programme.title: Puppet Master
programme.desc: After being contacted by their mysterious former colleague, four psychics arrive at a secluded hotel where they are stalked by a group of murderous puppets.

programme.title: Puppet Master II
programme.desc: The malicious marionettes are back to resurrect their dead master and evict parapsychologists from the family estate.

programme.title: Dobermann
programme.desc: The Dobermann and his gang have been hitting the headlines. Banks, post-offices, bullion vans! The whole works! An anthology of robbery, a compilation of hold-ups!

programme.title: Black Death
programme.desc: Set during the time of the first outbreak of bubonic plague in England, a young monk is given the task of learning the truth about reports of people being brought back to life in a small village.

programme.title: Sasquatch Sunset
programme.desc: In the misty forests of North America, a family of Sasquatches find themselves on a collision course with the ever-changing world around them.

programme.title: To Catch a Killer
programme.desc: Detective Joe Kozenczak (Michael Riley) tracks down John Wayne Gacy (Brian Dennehy), convicted in 1980 of 33 Chicago serial killings.

programme.title: Joint Security Area
programme.desc: After a shooting incident at the North-South Korean border DMZ leaves two North Korean soldiers dead, a neutral Swiss and Swedish team investigates what actually happened.

programme.title: A Bittersweet Life
programme.desc: A gangster (Lee Byung-hun) starts a violent feud after he refuses to kill his boss's (Kim Yeong-cheol) cheating girlfriend.

programme.title: Dark Diamond
programme.desc: After his father's death, a man vows vengeance against the relatives who abandoned him.

programme.title: God is a Bullet
programme.desc: After his ex-wife is murdered and his daughter is kidnapped, Bob Hightower, infiltrates the group to hunt down their leader with the help of the cult's only female victim escapee.

programme.title: Infernal Affairs
programme.desc: Chen Wing Yan, a young police officer, has been sent undercover as a mole in the local mafia. Lau Kin Ming, a young mafia member, infiltrates the police force.

programme.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe
programme.desc: A father and son, both coroners, are pulled into a complex mystery while attempting to identify the body of a young woman.

programme.title: Sator
programme.desc: Secluded in a desolate forest, a broken family is observed by the demon Sator who is attempting to claim them.

programme.title: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre
programme.desc: Teenagers are tortured, chopped up and impaled on meat hooks by a demented backwards family. This grisly 1974 blood-curdler ranks with Psycho and Halloween as a landmark in the horror/slasher genre.

programme.title: Noroi: The Curse
programme.desc: A paranormal journalist named Kobayashi goes missing shortly after completing a documentary. What begins as an investigation into strange noises soon evolves into the chilling mystery of a demonic entity.

programme.title: The House That Jack Built
programme.desc: USA in the 1970s. We follow the highly intelligent Jack over a span of 12 years and are introduced to the murders that define his development as a serial killer.

programme.title: Quest for Fire
programme.desc: A prehistoric Cro-Magnon tribe depends on an ever-burning source of fire, which eventually extinguishes. Lacking the knowledge of how to start a new one, the tribe sends three warriors on a quest.

programme.title: All New Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Follows Yorkshire-based law enforcers, shows the day-to-day situations the police deal with, from theft, to drugs and high speed chases.

programme.title: Helicopter ER
programme.desc: Helicopter rescues by the Yorkshire Air Ambulance.
